item.title: Elixir
item.description: Elixir is a dynamically-typed functional programming language. 1. Intractive elixir environment $ iex 2. Hello World! intro.exs #!/bin/elixir IO.puts("Hello" <> " Elixir!!") 3. Build Tool mix help mix new mix compile mix test mix run Create mix new example

item.title: ttr
item.description: 1. Intro Okay, letâ€™s do it. Test const char *colorname[] = { /* 8 normal colors */ [0] = "#0a0c0d", /* black */ [1] = "#504F45", /* red */ [2] = "#64604F", /* green */ [3] = "#70694D", /* yellow */ [4] = "#8B7651", /* blue */ [5] = "#AA9853", /* magenta */ [6] = "#B2A354", /* cyan */ [7] = "#ded0a7", /* white */ /* 8 bright colors */ [8] = "#9b9174", /* black */ [9] = "#504F45", /* red */ [10] = "#64604F", /* green */ [11] = "#70694D", /* yellow */ [12] = "#8B7651", /* blue */ [13] = "#AA9853", /* magenta */ [14] = "#B2A354", /* cyan */ [15] = "#ded0a7", /* white */ /* special colors */ [256] = "#0a0c0d", /* background */ [257] = "#ded0a7", /* foreground */ [258] = "#ded0a7", /* cursor */ }; /* Default colors (colorname index) * foreground, background, cursor */ unsigned int defaultbg = 0; unsigned int defaultfg = 257; unsigned int defaultcs = 258; unsigned int defaultrcs= 258; 2.
